2.text: “How I long for the months gone by, for the days when God watched over me,

3.text: when His lamp shone above my head, and by His light I walked through the darkness,

4.text: when I was in my prime, when the friendship of God rested on my tent,

5.text: when the Almighty was still with me and my children were around me,

6.text: when my steps were bathed in cream and the rock poured out for me streams of oil!

7.text: When I went out to the city gate and took my seat in the public square,

8.text: the young men saw me and withdrew, and the old men rose to their feet.

9.text: The princes refrained from speaking and covered their mouths with their hands.

10.text: The voices of the nobles were hushed, and their tongues stuck to the roofs of their mouths.

11.text: For those who heard me called me blessed, and those who saw me commended me,

12.text: because I rescued the poor who cried out and the fatherless who had no helper.

13.text: The dying man blessed me, and I made the widow’s heart sing for joy.

14.text: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me; justice was my robe and my turban.

15.text: I served as eyes to the blind and as feet to the lame.

16.text: I was a father to the needy, and I took up the case of the stranger.

17.text: I shattered the fangs of the unjust and snatched the prey from his teeth.

18.text: So I thought: ‘I will die in my nest and multiply my days as the sand.

19.text: My roots will spread out to the waters, and the dew will rest nightly on my branches.

20.text: My glory is ever new within me, and my bow is renewed in my hand.’

21.text: Men listened to me with expectation, waiting silently for my counsel.

22.text: After my words, they spoke no more; my speech settled on them like dew.

23.text: They waited for me as for rain and drank in my words like spring showers.

24.text: If I smiled at them, they did not believe it; the light of my countenance was precious.

25.text: I chose their course and presided as chief. So I dwelt as a king among his troops, as a comforter of the mourners.
